<line: 17> Defendant

[TITLE]
<line: 19> ORDER SETTING CONDITIONS OF RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 21> IT IS ORDERED that the defendant's release is subject to these conditions:

[TITLE]
<line: 23> (1) The defendant must not violate federal, state, or local law while on release..
<line: 24> (2)The defendant must cooperate in the collection of a DNA sample if it is authorized by 42 U.S.C.  14135a.
<line: 25> (3) The defendant must advise the court or the pretrial services office or supervising officer in writing before making
<line: 26> any change of residence or telephone number.
<line: 27> (4) The defendant must appear in court as required and, if convicted, must surrender as directed to serve a sentence that
<line: 28> the court may impose.
<line: 29> The defendant must appear at:
<line: 30> U.S. DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF PUERTO RICO,
<line: 31> Place
<line: 32> SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO
<line: 33> on
<line: 34> ALL FUTURE SCHEDULED PROCEEDINGS
<line: 35> Date and Time

[TEXT]
<line: 37> If blank, defendant will be notified of next appearance..

[TEXT]
<line: 39> (5) The defendant must sign an Appearance Bond, if ordered..

[TEXT]
<line: 41> Bail set at $1,000 unsecured.

[ABANDON]

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> AO 199B (Rev. 12/11) Additional Conditions of Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> Page 2 of 3 Pages

[TITLE]
<line: 6> ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS OF RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 8> IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the defendant's release is subject to the conditions marked below:

[TEXT]
<line: 10> 6
<line: 11> The defendant is placed in the custody of:
<line: 12>  Person or organization
<line: 13> Address (only if above is an organization)
<line: 14> City and state.
<line: 15> Tel. No.
<line: 16> who agrees to (a) supervise the defendant, (b) use every effort to assure the defendant's appearance at all court proceedings, and (c) notify the court immediately

[TEXT]
<line: 18> if the defendant violates a condition of release or is no longer in the custodian's custody.

[TEXT]
<line: 20> Signed:
<line: 21> Custodian
<line: 22> Date

[TEXT]
<line: 24> (X) (7) The defendant must:
<line: 25> U.S. Probation Office, Pertrial Division, Room 400,
<line: 26> ( X ) (a) submit to supervision by and report for supervision to the Hato Rey, P.R.
<line: 27> telephone number (787) 766-5596
<line: 28> , no later than 48 hours and thereafter as directed
<line: 29> ) (b) continue or actively seek employment.

[TEXT]
<line: 31> (c) continue or start an education program.
<line: 32> ( ) (d) surrender any passport to:

[TEXT]
<line: 34> U.S. PROBATION OFFICE

[TEXT]
<line: 36> (X ) (e) not obtain a passport or other international travel document.
<line: 37> ( X ) (f) abide by the following restrictions on personal association, residence, or travel: Shall reside at address of record; shall not leave

[TEXT]
<line: 39> jurisdiction of this district without first obtaining written permission from the Court. Shall not enter any airport or pier, unless authorized by PT Officer.
<line: 40> ( X ) (g) avoid all contact, directly or indirectly, with any person who is or may be a victim or witness in the investigation or prosecution,
<line: 41> including: unless accompanied by counsel.

[TEXT]
<line: 43> ) (h) get medical or psychiatric treatment:

[TEXT]
<line: 45> (
<line: 46> ) (i) return to custody each
<line: 47> at
<line: 48> o'clock after being released at
<line: 49> o'clock for employment, schooling,.
<line: 50> or the following purposes:
<line: 51> ) () maintain residence at a halfway house or community corrections center, as the pretrial services office or supervising officer considers

[TEXT]
<line: 53> necessary.

[TEXT]
<line: 55> X ) (k) not possess a firearm, destructive device, or other weapon.

[TEXT]
<line: 57> (X) (l) not use alcohol(
<line: 58> ) at all ( X )excessively

[TEXT]
<line: 60> (X ) (m) not use or unlawfully possess a narcotic drug or other controlled substances defined in 21 U.S.C.  802, unless prescribed by a licensed
<line: 61> medical practitioner.

[TEXT]
<line: 63> )(n) submit to testing for a prohibited substance ifrequired by the pretrial services office or supervising officer. Testing may be used with random
<line: 64> frequency and may include urine testing, the wearing of a sweat patch, a remote alcohol testing system, and/or any form of prohibited
<line: 65> substance screening or testing. The defendant must not obstruct, attempt to obstruct, or tamper with the efficiency and accuracy of prohibited
<line: 66> substance screening or testing.
<line: 67> ) (o) participate in a program of inpatient or outpatient substance abuse therapy and counseling if directed by the pretrial services office or

[TEXT]
<line: 69> supervising officer.

[TEXT]
<line: 71> )(p) *participate in one of the following location restriction programs and comply with its requirements as directed.
<line: 72> ) (i) Curfew. You are restricted to your residence every day (

[TEXT]
<line: 74> ) from
<line: 75> to
<line: 76> or
<line: 77> ) as
<line: 78> directed by the pretrial services office or supervising officer; or
<line: 79> ) (ii) Home Detention. You are restricted to your residence at all times except for employment; education; religious services; medical,

[TEXT]
<line: 81> substance abuse, or mental health treatment; attorney visits; court appearances; court-ordered obligations; or other activities
<line: 82> approved in advance by the pretrial services office or supervising officer; or
<line: 83> ) (ii) Home Incarceration. You are restricted to 24-hour-a-day lock-down at your residence except for medical necessities and

[TEXT]
<line: 85> (
<line: 86> court appearances or other activities specifically approved by the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 88> ) (q) *submit to location monitoring as directed by the pretrial services office or supervising officer and comply with all of the program
<line: 89> requirements and instructions provided. Defendant must not obstruct, attempt to obstruct, or tamper with the efficiency and accuracy of
<line: 90> any location monitoring device.
<line: 91> () You must pay all or part of the cost of the program based on your ability to pay as determined by the pretrial services office or
<line: 92> supervising officer.

[TEXT]
<line: 94> ( X ) (r) report as soon as possible, to the pretrial services office or supervising officer, every contact with law enforcement personnel, including
<line: 95> arrests, questioning, or traffic stops.

[TEXT]
<line: 97> to mainland U.S. only, not exceeding 15 days, provided the U.S. Attorney has no objection to it. If objected, request will have to
<line: 98> be made in writing to the Court.

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> AO 199C (Rev. 09/08) Advice of Penalties

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> Page
<line: 5> 3
<line: 6> of
<line: 7> 3
<line: 8> Pages

[TITLE]
<line: 10> ADVICE OF PENALTIES AND SANCTIONS

[TITLE]
<line: 12> TO THE DEFENDANT:

[TITLE]
<line: 14> YOU ARE ADVISED OF THE FOLLOWING PENALTIES AND SANCTIONS:

[TEXT]
<line: 16> Violating any of the foregoing conditions of release may result in the immediate issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a
<line: 17> revocation of your release, an order of detention, a forfeiture of any bond, and a prosecution for contempt of court and could result in
<line: 18> imprisonment, a fine, or both..
<line: 19> While on release, if you commit a federal felony offense the punishment is an additional prison term of not more than ten years

[TEXT]
<line: 21> and for a federal m isdemeanor offense the punishment is an additional prison term of not more than one year. This sentence will be
<line: 22> consecutive (i.e., in addition to) to any other sentence you receive..
<line: 23> It is a crime punishable by up to ten years in prison, and a $250,o00 fine, or both, to: obstruct a criminal investigation;

[TEXT]
<line: 25> tamper with a witness, victim, or informant; retaliate or attenpt to retaliate against a witness, victimor informant; or intimidate or attempt
<line: 26> to intimidate a witness, victim, juror, informant, or officer of the court. The penalties for tampering, retaliation, or intim idation are
<line: 27> significantly more serious if they involve a killing or attempted killing.
<line: 28> If, after release, you knowingly fail to appear as the conditions of release require, or to surrender to serve a sentence,

[TEXT]
<line: 30> you may be prosecuted for failing to appear or surrender and additional punishment may be imposed. If you are convicted of:
<line: 31> (1) an offense punishable by death, life imprisonment, or imprisonment for a term of fifteen years or more -- you will be fined

[TEXT]
<line: 33>  not more than $250,000 or imprisoned for not more than 10 years, or both;
<line: 34> (2) an offense punishable by imprisonment for a tern of five years or more, but less than fifteen years - you will be fined not
<line: 35> more than $250,o00 or imprisoned for not more than five years, or both;
<line: 36> (3) any other felony -- you will be fined not more than $250,000 or imprisoned not more than two years, or both;
<line: 37> (4) a misdemeanor -- you will be fined not more than $100,o00 or imprisoned not more than one year, or both.
<line: 38> A term of imprisonment inposed for failure to appear or surrender will be consecutive to any other sentence you receive. In

[TEXT]
<line: 40> addition, a failure to appear or surrender may result in the forfeiture of any bond posted.

[TITLE]
<line: 42> Acknowledgment of the Defendant.

[TEXT]
<line: 44> I acknowledge that I amthe defendant inthis case and that I am aware ofthe conditions of release. I pronise to obey all conditions
<line: 45> of release, to appear as directed,and surrender to serve any sentence imposed. I am aware of the penalties and sanctions setforth above.

[FIGURE]
<line: 47> Defendant's Signature
<line: 48> N Puerto Rico
<line: 49> City and State

[TITLE]
<line: 51> Directions to the United States Marshal

[TEXT]
<line: 53> (/) The defendant is ORDERED released after processing.
<line: 54> ) The United States marshal is ORDERED to keep the defendant in custody until notified by the clerk or judge that the defendant
<line: 55>  has posted bond and/or complied with all other conditions for release. If still in custody, the defendant must be produced before
<line: 56> the appropriate judge at the time and place specified..
<line: 57> Date:
<line: 58> 3/1/2017
<line: 59> Judicial Officer's Signature

[TEXT]
<line: 61> Bruce J. McGiverin, U.S. Magistrate Judge

[ABANDON]
<line: 63> Printed name and title
